What’s new

We are continually improving the California State Web Template. View release features by date for items that have been added or updated.

If you are new here, you may find our getting started page helpful.

Release features

State Web Template release updates table featuring version number, release date, and the release high level description
Version Date Description
6.0.8 7-30-22
  • Updated site structure and framework to use eleventy site generation and replaced server site includes with njk includes and templates
  • Added new components such as feature card, link grid, and side navigation
  • Updated State Web Template's styles to make structural components to look like CA Design System
6.0.7 12-16-21
  • Added responsive font size calculation functionality and adjusted some of the components to responsive font sizing
6.0.6 11-24-21
  • Removed jQuery
6.0.5 06-02-21
  • Removed unused JS libraries and made fixes to service tites and carousel components
6.0.4 04-21-21
  • Fixed links accessibility issues and updated jQuery version
6.0.3 03-26-21
  • Fixed multiple accessibility issues
6.0.2 04-28-20
  • Added 22 more new icons (including COVID-19 icons) to the CaGov font library
6.0.1 01-31-20
  • Updated accordion keyboard accessibility
  • Added parallax sample page
6.0.0 01-31-20
  • Added new pages that provide more usability directions
  • Added new modules such as blurb, modal and timeline
  • Added new color schemes such as Delta, Santa Cruz and Shasta
  • Added new icons to CAGov font library

Find complete release changelogs on GitHub production release page

Update your template

  1. Save a backup

    Before updating the latest State Web Template version, save a backup of your current site. This will enable you to restore your current site if system errors occur during the update.
  2. Download the latest State Web Template release

    Use our GitHub repository to download the latest release. If you are using State Web Template CDN, update your CDN links to the latest release.
  3. Compare release changes

    After downloading the latest state template files, complete a thorough code comparison by:

    ● Option 1. Locally comparing files side-by-side.

    ● Option 2. Comparing your local files to State Web Template files in GitHub.

    ● Comparing release branches on GitHub.

    To do so you need to make new pull request then can select a release branch name from the compare drop down menu at the top of the page. Here's an example of a comparison between two State Web Template release branches.
  4. Inspect CSS and JavaScript changes

    Most changes are made in the CSS and JavaScript files. Compare those changes thoroughly. Look for the State Web Template CSS and JavaScript source files in /src/scss/ and /src/js/ folders. Update your source CSS and JS files if necessary.

  5. Check for structural changes

    Look for structural code changes to your components in one of these folders:

    ● State Web Template /src/_includes/

    ● State Web Template /src/_includes/modules/

    Update your code if necessary.
  6. Copy site fonts

    Copy the fonts files from /src/fonts/ folder.
  7. Build and test your site

    Build and run your site locally. Make sure there are no NPM or other errors when using build commands. Test your site with manual and automatic accessibility testing of all updated pages.
